page.title: 03ST.MARTINS CHURCH,DORKING
page.content: St.Martins Church in South Street Dorking,is situated in quiet well kept grounds next to the Friday Market site. Its spire is 210 feet tall,the second tallest in England.In 851 a Saxon church was burnt down on this site.Dorking Parish Church was mentioned in the 1088 Domesday Book.There are eight bells dating from 1626 to 1709.They were lastly rehung in 1878.The organ was built in 1831 and has 45 speaking stops.There are beautiful stain glass windows and also childrens illustrations from the Old Testament- eg.Noah,Adam and Eve etc.There are lovely moscaics in this church from 1890.The puptit is 19th century and the carvings are 17th century. The whole church is full of old wood and is a lovely place for tourists. Lastly St.Martins Church also has a
